Summary: group of 15 or so bright orange orb lights, moving then simultaneously changing direction.
divs: sighting detailsit was about 8:15 and i was on huntingdon pike in rockledge, pa. as i was approaching shady lane, heading westbound, i saw in front of me, above the horizon, and for about what i would estimate a string of 5 or 10 miles in the sky, a random pattern of bright, very bright orange orbs all moving in unison. i thought at first i saw two airplanes in single file coming at me, but they were moving southwesterly after observing them... then i started to see behind them approx 14-16 more, covering a wide patch of sky, all moving together. i pulled over and took a pair of 10x50 binoculars out and looked at them, there were no blinking or airplane lights, no identifiable features, just a bright orange globe. after watching them slowly move from my 11 o'clock position to around 10 o'clock to my forward left, they simultaneously all turned south at the same moment, and within about 10 seconds, accelerated and disappeared from view. here is a google streetview of the direction i was facing..
